item.title: Today’s Wordle #1680: Hints and Answer for January 24, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1680 for January 24, 2026

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, January 24, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1680 is a pretty simple puzzle. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4 of 6 guesses. That makes it easier as the 4.6-guess average from January 23.

General Wordle Hints For January 24

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word refers to a natural feature, not something man-made.
  • Hint 2: It’s often associated with height or a sudden drop.
  • Hint 3: You’ll commonly see it used in adventure or travel contexts.
  • Hint 4: The word frequently appears in phrases that suggest danger or suspense.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1680 for January 24, 2026.

Starter Words For January 24, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • FLICK
  • CLIMB
  • SLICK
  • FLUFF

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1680 On January 24, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: CLIFF

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

CLIFF is a noun that means “a high steep face of a rock” or “a critical point or situation beyond which something bad or undesirable may occur.”

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1679 on January 23, 2026

Answer: BARON

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1679?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on January 25 will be Wordle Game #1681.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…

item.title: Pokémon TCG Pocket B2 Fantastical Parade—Release Date, Start Time & Confirmed Cards List
item.content:encoded:
Fantastical Parade is a fantastical name for the first new Pokémon TCG Pocket set of 2026. The new B2 set brings new cards, new Shinies, and new Mega ex variations. Fantastical Parade B2 is kicking off the new year with a bang, and IG has the Pokémon TCG Pocket Fantastical Parade release date, start times, and more.

It hasn’t gone unnoticed that developers Creatures Inc. and DeNA have taken feedback on board. The regularity of Pokémon sets has eased up since the first anniversary, and the Deluxe ex set has been a big help. It’s now time for Set B2, and Fantastical Parade is looking to party on through the night (and every other night).

When Is Pokémon TCG Pocket B2 Fantastical Parade Releasing?

Pokémon TCG Pocket B2 Fantastical Parade comes out on Wednesday, January 28, although this will change depending on your time zone and region.

Only a few days to wait for a new Pokémon Pocket set. If by some miracle you still haven’t finished Crimson Blaze, you have time. Plus, get those last few packs of Deluxe ex in before it goes away again.

Pokémon TCG Pocket B2 Fantastical Parade Start Times

Fantastical Parade gets underway at 5 PM in PT, and other time zones are adjusted accordingly.

Here’s the full list of start dates and times for you to browse. Not everyone is so lucky!

Pokémon TCG Pocket B2 Fantastical Parade Card List

Through a combination of rewatching the Fantastical Parade trailer numerous times and the latest information, 19 cards were known before the set’s full launch.

Take a look at every B2 Fantastical Parade that’s been spotted.

For the latest conversation on Pokémon TCG Pocket or Pokémon in general, head over to the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server. Say what you like about the Fantastical Parade cards so far, or all things Pokémon in 2026!

If you’ve missed recent Pokémon content, catch up on Pokémon coming to Hytale through mods, the LEGO Pokémon Kanto Badge Collection being resold for big money, and all LEGO Pokémon sets and how to pre-order.

item.title: ARC Raiders 2026 Roadmap Contains Four Months of Content
item.content:encoded:
Embark Studios has revealed a four-month roadmap for ARC Raiders, the studio’s new extraction adventure title that was released in October 2025. The roadmap, which spans January to April, is a long-awaited thing that fans have been begging for, and now that it’s here, it promises plenty.

Each month boasts a unique theme that comes with new ARC enemies, map improvements, quality-of-life changes, and events galore. If nothing else, the ARC Raiders 2026 roadmap promises to hugely expand the game’s lore.

ARC Raiders Roadmap Finally Unveiled

ARC Raiders was in a rocky place coming out of the festive period. The game fell prey to some issues over the holiday break, and exploits and cheaters alike were running rampant. As soon as Embark Studios got back into the office, things sharpened up a bit, and now that the roadmap is here, fans finally have something to look forward to.

That includes a four-part update spree that rewards players with new content once per month.

Here’s the full spread:

January – Headwinds

  • New matchmaking option (level 40+)
  • New minor map condition
  • Player project

February – Shrouded Sky

  • New map condition
  • New ARC threat
  • Player project
  • Raider Deck
  • Map update
  • Expedition window

March – Flashpoint

  • New map condition
  • New ARC threat
  • Player project
  • Scrappy update

April – Riven Tides

  • New map
  • New large ARC
  • New map condition
  • Expedition window

The introduction of the first new map condition in February should bring about Toxic Swamp, which was discovered weeks ago by eagle-eyed gamers. We’ve also known for a while that February will yield a new Raider Deck and Expedition window.

What’s not so amazing is that we need to wait until April to get a large-scale ARC threat and a new map, but talk of a ‘map update’ in February is enough to potentially keep players engaged.

Plenty is coming in ARC Raiders, and the roadmap is indicative of all the work Embark Studios is doing – and plans to keep doing – to keep this game growing and thriving.

What part of the ARC Raiders roadmap are you most looking forward to? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Vampire Crawlers is getting a demo next month

Grant's passion for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC when he wasn't even old enough to walk properly. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with an undying love for the…

item.title: All ARC Raiders February 2026 Content—Map Update, Raider Deck & More
item.content:encoded:
Embark Studios has finally revealed its plans for the future of ARC Raiders, and as you could expect, it’s chock full of content.

This was all revealed in a recent ARC Raiders 2026 Roadmap, where content for the next four months was laid out. A few bits drop in the remainder of January with the release of Headwinds, such as a new Player Project and Minor Map Condition, but the real fun begins in February with Shrouded Sky.

Check out this guide for everything to know about the new content coming to ARC Raiders in February 2026.

Every Piece Of New Content Coming To ARC Raiders In February 2026

As things stand, the Escalation Roadmap for ARC Raiders suggests that plenty of new content is on the way, including a new Map Condition, new ARC, and even a new Map Update.

And somehow, that’s not all, as February is gearing up to be a major month in ARC Raiders. Here’s everything coming to ARC Raiders during the Shrouded Sky updates.

  • New Map Condition
  • New ARC Threat
  • Player Project
  • Raider Deck
  • Map Update
  • Expedition Window

It’s a comprehensive list, and each phrase has a small image next to it, which might hint at more details. For example, the New Map Condition is pictured alongside a gust of wind—can we expect a storm to hit certain maps? As for the new ARC threat, a flying insect is shown, implying another airborne ARC is on the way.

When Will The February Content Release In ARC Raiders?

There is no detailed release window for the upcoming content, but it’s fair to assume that when it does drop, it’ll be at the usual ARC Raiders timings: 1:30 a.m. PT / 4:30 a.m. ET / 9:30 a.m. GMT / 10:30 a.m. CET

It looks like it’s going to be an exciting month, but it can be frustrating to be left guessing when it could all arrive. It’s reasonable to assume that Embark Studios will scatter the content throughout the month to keep the game as fresh as possible.

That’s how they’ve handled it in the past, but everything is subject to change as it draws ever nearer. As usual, Insider Gaming will keep this article updated should anything change or be announced.

What do you make of the upcoming content? Is it enough to keep ARC Raiders exciting? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more ARC Raiders, find out what First Wave Husks are, as well as how to open the Hidden Bunker.

item.title: Vampire Crawlers Demo Releases Next Month
item.content:encoded:
Vampire Crawlers fans can check out the game through a demo arriving for Steam and Xbox in February 2026.

A dungeon-crawling, roguelike deckbuilder spin-off of Vampire Survivors, Vampire Crawlers, was announced during the Xbox Partner Preview event last year, with a Day One release set for Game Pass Premium and Ultimate. The title is scheduled to arrive in 2026, but could be delayed if the devs think it isn’t ready. However, whether it is ready or not, players can try out the game next month on Xbox and Steam through a new demo.

Vampire Crawlers Demo Announced for Steam and Xbox

As revealed through Episode 1 of “Let’s Explore Vampire Crawlers” on YouTube, the demo for Vampire Crawlers will release on February 23 for Steam and Xbox. The video also talks more about the upcoming title, with the devs revealing the main focus this time is “fast turn-based combat”. The devs have recognised that one of the main complaints about some of the most popular turn-based games is that they can be slow and repetitive, and that’s what they want to change.

To circumvent this issue, many devs offer ways to speed up the gameplay by introducing “fast-forward” or “skip-animation” features. However, animations in the games are where all the fun lies, which is why in Vampire Crawlers, players don’t need to wait for the animation to complete to trigger the next abilities. What’s more, the game will not just attack enemies in the front, but will spread to all targets.

The new feature, called Turbo Turn, enables players to perform rapid attacks on enemies without requiring excessive resource management. This feature is particularly beneficial for beginners. However, there’s also something for veterans of the genre. As you play and progress, you can find relics and treasures that unlock new gameplay options involving the cards. Additionally, there’s a gem customization mechanic that allows players to enhance their cards with various effects.

In other news, Vampire: The Masquerage – Bloodhunt is going offline in April 2026. Will you be trying out the Vampire Crawlers demo next month? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Forza Horizon 6’s early access still costing $60 for Game Pass subscribers. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
